title: Lebanese central bank chief says providing dollars to local markets
text:
FILE PHOTO: Lebanon's Central Bank Governor Riad Salameh is seen at the Beirut economic conference in Beirut, Lebanon November 15, 2018. REUTERS/Mohamed Azakir/File Photo

BEIRUT (Reuters) - The head of Lebanon’s central bank said on Monday it is continuing to provide dollars to local financial markets, adding the country has “numerous possibilities” as it looks for assistance to curb a sharp loss of investor confidence.

“We know there is a lot of noise about the monetary situation, however the capacities are available and we are continuing to secure dollars to the markets in Lebanon,” Banque du Liban Governor Riad Salameh, who is in the United Arab Emirates for meetings, said in comments to journalists distributed by Tele Liban.

Asked if the UAE may provide Lebanon with financial assistance by subscribing to a bond issue, he said: “There are numerous possibilities and discussions. But this matter is left to heads of state. They will decide.”
description: The head of Lebanon's central bank said on Monday it is continuing to provide dollars to local financial markets, adding the country has "numerous possibilities" as it looks for assistance to curb a sharp loss of investor confidence.
